'Deoxyguanosine' is composed of the purine nucleoside guanine linked by its N9
nitrogen to the C1 carbon of deoxyribose. It is similar to guanosine, but with
one hydroxyl group removed from the 2' position of the ribose sugar (making it
deoxyribose). If a phosphate group is attached at the 5' position, it becomes
deoxyguanosine monophosphate.
